orch_serv.stepper package¶

Submodules¶

orch_serv.stepper.stepper module¶

class orch_serv.stepper.stepper.Step(obj: Callable, **kwargs: Any)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for configuration Step of Stepper flow :attr __obj: obj object that contains logic :type __obj: Callable :attr __kwargs: additional kwargs for execution step

which are not returned from the previous step

Example:

>>> def example_function(val: int , arg_1: int = 1) -> int:
>>>     return val + arg_1
>>> step_1 = Step(example_function )
>>> step_1.execute(1) # return: 2
>>> step_2 = Step(example_function, arg_1=2 )
>>> step_1.execute(1) # return: 3
__kwargs: dict[str, Any] = {}¶
__obj: Callable¶
execute(data_to_execute: Any) → Any[source]¶
property kwargs: dict[str, Any]¶
property obj: Callable¶
class orch_serv.stepper.stepper.Stepper(steps: StepsBuilder | None = None, is_execute_if_empty: bool | None = None, logger: Logger | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

class for forming a flow where the input data

of step n is the output of step n

__is_execute_if_empty: bool = False¶
__step_by_step(*args: Any) → Any¶
__steps: StepsBuilder¶
property is_execute_if_empty: bool¶
execute the next step with the data of the previous one

if the current step did not return anything

Returns:

step_by_step(*args: Any) → Any[source]¶
property steps: StepsBuilder¶

Property contains a class with all blocks for the current flow :return: StepsBuilder

Function for validate data consistency between steps :param Callable obj: obj to execution :param return_previous_obj: annotations returned from previous step :param additional_args: kwargs for execution obj :return: nothing :raises DataConsistencyError: if not consistent data
